title: Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: jacket clue found in grimsby murder investigation .

documents.title: nhs tracker : check key targets in your area
text: nhs tracker : check key targets in your area

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me and the team in lincoln for today - we 'll be back at 08.00 on monday with more of the very latest from across the county .
just before we sign off for the evening there 's time to look back at five things we 've discovered during the day :
till next week !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: appeal after gainsborough robbery
text: a man 's wanted by police after a robbery in gainsborough yesterday afternoon .
officers say he carried out the offence between 14.25 and 14.55 between the tesco store and the underpass on sandsfield lane , gainsborough .

he 's described as broad , 5ft 9ins with brown untidy hair , a local accent , and stained teeth , and described as wearing a green jacket , dark blue jeans with mud stains on his knees , and black trainers ,
it 's alleged he pushed the victim into a wall causing minor facial injuries , then took money.if you were in the area and saw anything related to the incident call 101

documents.title: godmother told nurse 'i killed baby '
text: godmother told nurse 'i killed baby '

documents.title: two charged over street assault death
text: two charged over street assault death

documents.title: traffic and travel : a46 delays
text: we 're getting reports that there 's a crash on the a46 lincoln bypass near the carholme roundabout .
motorists are reporting long tailbacks to the skellingthorpe roundabout .

documents.title: two charged with murder
text: a man and a woman have both been charged with the murder of 45-year-old tony richardson .
marc finnie , 44 , and his wife sarah finnie , 36 , of sutcliffe avenue , are due to appear before grimsby and cleethorpes magistrates court tomorrow morning .
mr richardson 's family has been informed and continue to be supported by specialist officers .

detective chief inspector stewart miller , who has led the investigation , said : we are very grateful to the public for their assistance and support throughout our investigation into this tragic incident . ''

documents.title: court rules hare coursing dogs can be rehomed
text: two dogs which were seized from hare coursers in lincolnshire are to be rehomed .
it 's the first time the courts have ruled in this way .
in the past dogs were eventually returned to their owners .
lurchers lucky and spencer had been kept in kennels since last september , when their owners were arrested .

documents.title: council leader 'optimistic ' over bypass
text: it 's hoped there 'll be positive news in the next week over lincoln 's eastern bypass project after the collapse of the main contractor responsible for building it .
work on the route ground to a halt after construction giant carillion stopped trading last week , leaving many subcontractors and local firms questioning if they 'll get paid .
but martin hill , the leader of lincolnshire county council says he 's hopeful they 'll be able to make an announcement in the next few days .
at this stage we 're in negotiations - ca n't really say exactly what 's happeneing but persinally i 'm very optimistic about where we 'll get to next week

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: last day of traveller consultation
text: it 's the last day for people in north east lincolnshire to have their say on where to provide a temporary stopover site for travellers .
there are currently no designated sites around grimsby , although all councils are legally required to provide them .
more than 1,000 potential locations have already been dismissed , and the council has been asking the public for their thoughts .

documents.title: home needed to p-p- up 6ft penguin
text: home needed to p-p- up 6ft penguin

documents.title: police back on hare coursing beat
text: here 's the latest tweet from lincolnshire police 's rural crime team - who are leading a major clampdown on illegal hare coursing in the county .
officers say as well as the arrests detailed below - they also have a dispersal order in place across the county .
the order allows them to move groups of suspected hare coursers on to disrupt their activities .
2 suspected # harecoursers have been arrested on susp of criminal damage & failing to stop for police .
2 vehicles & 1 dog seized .
officers searching for others believed actively # harecoursing in area .
# opgalileo
thank you for all you do on # opgalileo .
reading these tweets gives me confidence that you 're really making an impact on dealing with this for the hares , the dogs and the affected rural communities .
well done .
thank you
well done guys , now crush the cars and rehome the dog , it will no doubt get a better life .
are those vehicles both beached on top of the bank ?

documents.title: pick up a penguin and help maureen downsize
text: a grantham woman 's appealing for a new home for her penguin - because she wants to move house .
maureen bailey , who 's 75 , won the cuddly bird more than a decade ago .
since then she 's put up with him in her house on dudley road , but now she 's having a clear out so that she can move to a smaller property when she gets married later this year .
if you can help her , get in touch with us via email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
at the moment he 's standing in the dining room .
he 's been in the hallway .
most people who see him ca n't believe it and then they go and cuddle him and stroke him .
he 's 6ft tall and 10ft round .

documents.title: weather : cold this afternoon and wet later
text: looks like there 's some rain on the way for this evening 's rush hour - and it will be cold :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: air ambulance starts 24/7 operation
text: the air ambulance which covers northern lincolnshire will become a 24-hour service .
at the moment , crews from the lincolnshire and nottinghamshire air ambulance only respond to medical emergencies between 07:00 and 19:00 .
the charity says it will increase the annual running costs from £ 2.5m to £ 4m .
but the charity says its confident it will be able to raise the money needed .
it 's a pivotal moment in the charity 's history and we 're really proud and delighted to announce we 're moving to a 24/7 operation .
it 's only thanks to the fantastic fundraising support we receive from the communities of lincolnshire and nottinghamshire that we can do that .

documents.title: tony richardson murder investigation latest
text: police say they have now tracked down a jacket which they wanted to find in connection with a murder investigation in grimsby .
tony richardson , 45 , died in hospital after being attacked in old market place on monday afternoon .
following an appeal yesterday , a member of the public found the light grey jacket and contacted police .
humberside police say they are grateful for the public 's help with this investigation .
a 44-year-old man is currently in custody after being arrested on sus of murder .
a 36-year-old woman has been arrested on sus of incitement to murder .

documents.title: appeal to lincolnshire commuters over station blaze
text: british transport police are appealing to lincolnshire commuters to help with their investigation into last week 's arson at nottingham railway station .
the fire , which broke out last thursday night , caused major damage .
they believe that people who travel to and from the station for work may have important information to find those responsible :
arson appeal- did you see or hear anything that maybe valuable to our investigation ?
if so please contact british transport police on 0800 40 50 40 or text us on 61016 quote reference 85 of 12th january 2018
given it happened at 6.30am check if anyone was refused entry / evicted from the nearby homeless hostels the night before ?

documents.title: humber bridge 'urban explorer ' fined for scaling structure
text: humber bridge officials have vowed to get tough with people who try to climb the structure after a man was fined for breaching security .
ryan taylor was fined by magistrates in hull after scaling the safety barrierat the barton end of the bridge in may last year , and walking up the cables to the top of the south tower .
the case came about after the humber bridge brought a private prosecution .
taylor was among a group who scaled the bridge without safety equipment in the early hours of 15 may 2017 .
they took videos and of themselves at the top of the tower which they later posted on youtube and other social media channels .
they fled the bridge after being spotted by security cameras .
the fact that we prosecuted shows how seriously we take this offence - we 're pleased it was a heavy fine .
we are looking at further court action where we can against others who were involved .

documents.title: rural homelessness 'forgotten ' by authorities
text: a homeless charity in lincolnshire says people sleeping rough in small towns and rural areas are a forgotten problem .
homelessness in more isolated spots is growing at a faster rate than in bigger towns and cities , according to a recent uk-wide report .
the institute for public policy research study says rural homelessness is up by more than 52 % since 2010 .
those running an emergency shelter in boston say they know of people living in tents , sheds and shipping containers .
in the main towns and cities you have facilities , but in boston we have nothing - we have an emergency night shelter in the winter but no facilities for a permanent shelter .

documents.title: appeal over waste plant withdrawn
text: a waste disposal giant which had submitted plans for a plant on the edge of lincoln looks unlikely to pursue the scheme .
veolia had wanted to build the so-called waste transfer station on long leys road , close to the city 's west common .
permission for the idea was refused by lincolnshire county council , but veolia had appealed against that , saying it wanted to continue with the scheme .
however , council leader martin hill today confirmed the appeal had been withdrawn by the firm .
this is good news for local residents and the county council as we remained opposed to the proposed development due to its close proximity to many residential properties .

documents.title: police commissioner facing your questions
text: is crime a problem where you live ?
have you got an issue with the way police operate in your area ?
if so today 's your chance to speak direct to the man in charge of lincolnshire police and how it spends its money .
police and crime commissioner marc jones will be live on bbc radio lincolnshire between 09.00 and 10.00 and is ready for your questions .
you can send your questions in via bbc radio lincolnshire 's facebook or twitter .
author: Melvyn Prior
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : wintry showers on the way
text: a cold day on the way with sunny spells and scattered wintry showers .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: 'heartening ' response to police eastern european jobs call
text: lincolnshire police say they 've received more than 50 applications from people who are fluent in eastern european languages .
the force is looking for new recruits who can speak polish , latvian or lithuanian to help in areas with large migrant communities .
lincolnshire 's assistant chief officer , andrew white , says there 's been a lot of interest .
we held a drop-in centre last week at boston police station and we had around 30 people come into the station to talk to us about the recruitment and that is heartening

documents.title: welcome to friday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18.00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: two arrests over street assault death
text: two arrests over street assault death

documents.title: what we 've learned today
text: that 's all for our live coverage today , but fear not , we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow morning with more coverage from around the county .
in the meantime , breaking news , sport and travel stories will continue to appear here overnight .
i 'll leave you with four things we did n't know this morning :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: disability swings planned for boston park
text: a swing which can be used by people in wheelchairs is among additions planned for parks in boston .
boston charity local hope have raised £ 10,000 towards the cost of the swing .

boston borough council is also spending tens of thousands of pounds on new swings , new football goal posts , a roundabout , fitness equipment and a games area on the current tennis court in boston 's central park .
other improvements are planned at other parks in the town , including a basketball area at st john 's park and a multi-use games area at garfits lane .
in total nearly £ 100,000 is being spent , and most of the work is due to be finished in 2019 .

documents.title: nigerian businessman jailed for health trust fraud
text: a nigerian businessman is beginning a three-and-a-half year jail term in connection with a fraud case involving a health trust in lincolnshire .
walter wagbatsoma , 47 , is the 13th person to be convicted of conspiracy to launder money in an international fraud and money laundering investigation .
more than £ 1.2m was stolen from the lincolnshire partnership foundation trust in 2011 .
fraudulently obtained money from the nhs trust was laundered through an account in dubai .
the funds were then transferred to wagbatsoma 's account in the uk .

documents.title: second arrest in grimsby murder investigation
text: two people have been arrested as part of a murder investigation after a man died following an assault outside a bank in grimsby .
a 36-year-old woman has been a arrested on sus of incitement to murder while a 44-year-old man is in custody on sus of murder after the death of tony richardson .
mr richardson , 45 , died in hospital following an incident in old market place on monday afternoon .
officers are now appealing to find a jacket which they believe is connected to the investigation .
detective chief inspector stewart miller said : i want to re-iterate that the attack on tony was an isolated incident targeted towards him and not the wider community . ''

documents.title: lincolnshire hospitals `` not in winter crisis ''
text: the man at the helm of lincolnshire 's hospitals says they 're not in the grip of a winter crisis .
jan sobieraj , chief executive of united lincolnshire hospitals trust ( ulht ) , admits they 're under pressure , but insists that they 're coping .
it comes after labour leader jeremy corbyn said hospitals in the county needed `` more support '' and `` more investment '' .
he was visiting lincoln county hospital after criticising the government for presiding over an `` all-year-round funding crisis '' in the nhs .
we 've had a really busy winter so far we 've seen high numbers of patients , we 've seen very sick patients but we 're coping .

documents.title: watch : first look at long-awaited lincoln transport hub
text: it 's caused nearly 18 months of traffic problems and disruption to lincoln but today we get our first look at lincoln 's transport hub .
the £ 30m hub is due to open at the end of the month .
the redevelopment includes the bus station , multi-storey car park and renovations outside lincoln railway station .
here 's a look inside the new bus station :

documents.title: thatcher statue plan set to lose out
text: margaret thatcher looks set to lose out to two pioneering feminists in the battle to be the first woman to have a statue in parliament square .
rival campaigns have battled for years to be first to put a statue of a woman in front of the houses of parliament .
the grantham-born former prime minister was beaten in the competition by advocates of suffragist and trade union leader millicent fawcett .
she is set to join the 10 men in the square , including sir winston churchill and nelson mandela , later this year .
westminster council has recommended plans for the thatcher statue ( above ) to be refused but the decision will be made on tuesday .

documents.title: jeremy corbyn dismisses national health insurance idea
text: labour leader jeremy corbyn has dismissed a lincolnshire mp 's idea to have a national health insurance scheme .
mr corbyn 's been visiting lincoln county hospital today to draw attention to problems faced by the nhs .
grantham mp nick boles , who 's been treated for cancer twice , says people would be happy to pay higher taxes as long as they knew it would be spent on the nhs .
he suggested a completely separate funding stream called a national health insurance so people knew their money was being spent on healthcare .
but mr corbyn said the idea was not supported by labour :
what we would consider - and we will do - is raise corporate levels of of taxation in order to fund the nhs properly .
our plan is for £ 37bn to go into the nhs and £ 8bn into social care .

documents.title: breakingwoman dies after major crash near lincoln
text: a woman has died after a car crash in nettleham yesterday .
a black vauxhall meriva and silver toyota yaris were involved in the crash on the a46 .
the woman , in her 40s , died as a result of the collision .
a second woman , in her 80s , was taken to lincoln county hospital for treatment .
police are appealing for anyone who saw either of the vehicles in the area at around 15:30 to get in touch .

documents.title: the practical problems of policing laid bare for pcc
text: it can take `` several hours '' to arrest someone for even a minor offence , according to lincolnshire 's police and crime commissioner .
pcc marc jones discovered the fact after spending an `` eye opening '' night shift with officers .
he admitted that parts of the process were inefficient .
mr jones spent saturday night observing police in louth .
the pcc says it showed him some of the frustrations police face in the county .
the process to arrest someone for something as seemingly simple as driving under the influence of drugs , was more complicated than he expected .
the gentleman would need to be arrested , put in handcuffs .
a second officer had to arrive , because to transport someone in that position you need two police officers .
and then the nearest custody suite is in skegness so that 's where we went .
he said the whole process to arrest one person took `` several hours '' of valuable police time .
when asked whether it was an inefficient process , he said it `` absolutely '' was .

documents.title: police issue fallen tree help plea
text: police issue fallen tree help plea

documents.title: hundreds seek debt advice after christmas
text: more than 500 people contacted a lincolnshire debt advice company in one day this week .
so-called blue monday traditionally sees a rise in the number of people asking for help as post-christmas bills start to rack up .
debt advice firm payplan , based in grantham , says most people contacting them are worried they 're going to fall behind on their bills .
for some people debt has been building up and christmas has been the final straw .

documents.title: power restored to 4,700 homes after wind damage
text: about 4,700 homes have had their power restored this morning after high winds caused widespread disruption overnight .
in total , more than 5,000 properties lost power in lincolnshire in the early hours of this morning .
police say they received 102 reports of wind damage across the county .

documents.title: bomber command memorial from above
text: bomber command memorial from above

documents.title: missing trampoline found in hedge after high winds
text: a family in spalding will be jumping for joy after their trampoline , which went missing in high winds , was found .
a post on social media was widely shared after their trampoline blew away overnight .
luckily , it was discovered embedded in a hedge nearby .

documents.title: traffic problems after bridge closure
text: drivers in boston are facing major traffic problems just now after the closure of sluice bridge in the town .
the bridge and fydell street are closed between irby street and witham bank east (
it 's to replace the traffic lights there with a new type of crossing .

documents.title: grimsby bus stop aims to help people with dementia
text: a bus stop in grimsby is providing patients with dementia a quiet and safe place to help prevent them from becoming unsettled and anxious .
the health tree foundation ( htf ) , the official charity for grimsby hospital , has teamed up with stagecoach east midlands .
the national bus operator has provided a replica bus stop complete with a timetable , with the charity providing seats and wall art .
the stop , which is on ward b4 , has a real timetable of bus services in north lincolnshire , three pull down seats and the wall is decorated with trees , flowers and birds .
when dementia patients become confused and agitated they tend to wander and will often look for something which looks familiar .
the bus stop is just that . ''

documents.title: air ambulance starts 24/7 operation
text: lincolnshire and nottinghamshire 's air ambulance is to start operating 24 hours a day .
at the moment , crews only respond to medical emergencies between 07:00 and 19:00 .
the charity says it will increase the annual running costs from £ 2.5m to £ 4m .
but the charity says its confident it will be able to raise the money needed .
it 's a pivotal moment in the charity 's history and we 're really proud and delighted to announce we 're moving to a 24/7 operation .
it 's only thanks to the fantastic fundraising support we receive from the communities of lincolnshire and nottinghamshire that we can do that .

documents.title: travel : winds bring road and rail disruption
text: high winds overnight have affected the travel network across lincolnshire .
some of the roads affected by fallen trees are :
some coach services say they 're not operating this morning : cropley coaches in the boston area and are fowlers travel near spalding are n't operating their morning services .
the weather has also caused 30-minute delays on the east coast mainline after a tree fell on the overhead lines in stevenage .

documents.title: eighty trees blown over in high winds
text: more than 80 trees have been blown over in high winds in lincolnshire overnight .
lincolnshire police say they need help removing them .
western power distribution say they 've restored power supply to thousands of homes , but say there are still over 1,000- properties without electricity .
the power supply firm says they 're dealing with 60 faults , 20 of which are high voltage .

documents.title: watch : strong winds easing off
text: sunshine and scattered showers later .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: police appeal for help after 72mph winds
text: police are appealing for help to clear trees after high winds overnight have blown down at least 33 across the county .
the force is appealing for anyone with the `` relevant training '' , equipment and ability to clear trees to get in touch .
winds overnight reached 72mph in parts of stamford .
about 3,000 homes were left without power , with more than 1,200 of those between sleaford and bourne .

documents.title: good morning and welcome to thursday 's live coverage
text: good morning on this blustery thursday morning .
it 's harry here , guiding you through all the latest news , sport , and weather from across the county until 18:00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's all for our live coverage today , but never fear , we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow morning with more coverage from around the county .
in the meantime , breaking news , sport and travel stories will continue to appear here overnight .
i 'll leave you with five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : can you make a towel animal ?
text: butlins is , of course , well known for its red coats who sing and dance on stage at its resort in lincolnshire .
but today they 're recruiting for the slightly less glamorous roles at the resort at ingoldmells , near skegness , with a job fair being held to encourage people to work there .
however , in ty holiday resort style , the famous holiday company has managed to put a bit of razzle dazzle even into the most mundane of tasks .
one butlins employee showed off his skills :

documents.title: join the race for the cup ! # fapeoplescup
text: and now for a promotional message from our friends at bbc get inspired .
it 's time to enter the fa people 's cup - the nation 's free five-a-side tournament that gives you the chance to play at england 's training centre at st george 's park and go to the fa cup final .
you do n't have to play regularly - like this hockey lot - or even have ever played before !
there are 18 different categories so something for everyone - find out all the details here .

documents.title: 'we owe traders ' to tackle 'professional begging ' - mp
text: a westminster debate on vagrancy is being held , with cleethorpes mp martin vickers saying traders in the town are urging action on beggars .

mr vickers says the town owes it to its traders to tackle the problem , with a recent report by north east lincolnshire council finding that 16 people beg on the streets there , despite having a home .
the housing and homelessness minister has said that begging is an offence under the vagrancy act 1824 .
he added that the government hopes to halve rough sleeping by 2022 , and eliminate it altogether by 2027 .
author: Tim Iredale
Political editor, East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: teenager injured in louth glass attack
text: a teenager has been left with a facial injury after being hit with a glass or bottle in a pub in louth .
it happened last saturday at the wetherspoons pub in the town .
a man in his 20s has been arrested and released under investigation .
police are asking for anyone who may have seen what happened to come forward .

documents.title: hull and lincoln co-op bank closures
text: the co-operative bank has announced it 's to close several branches across the country , including one in lincoln and one in hull .
the hull branch will close on 17 may , while lincoln 's will shut on 24 may .
the co-operative bank says it 's closing the banks because more customers are choosing to use online banking services .
in a statement , the bank adds that it apologises for any inconvenience caused .

documents.title: plans to improve roads in bid to boost tourism
text: highways bosses in lincolnshire are meeting with business leaders this week to discuss major improvements to the county 's infrastructure .
it 's part of the county council 's desire to connect the coast with the western parts of lincolnshire .
richard davies , who 's in charge of highways , says the a158 between lincoln and skegness ( is a particular target for major improvements .

documents.title: 'appalling ' ambulance firm under fire
text: 'appalling ' ambulance firm under fire

documents.title: appeal over cleethorpes assault
text: police are asking for help in finding a man in connection with an assault on another man in cleethorpes earlier this month .
the victim was pushing a pram with his friend along daubney street at about midday on 4 january when a man approached him and assaulted him .
the man suffered serious but not life-threatening injuries and was taken to hospital for treatment .
anyone with information about the incident , details of which have only been released today , is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: county 's businesses encouraged to work together
text: lincolnshire businesses are being encouraged to work together to promote the county 's produce at a business fair today .
talks at the lincolnshire business expo are focusing on areas of growth for the county 's businesses .
expo founder dean graham says he wants to try and help lincolnshire firms buy from each other to encourage the county 's development .
we 're able to try and keep local business money a bit more local . ''

documents.title: closure of grantham a & e referred to health secretary again
text: the decision to close grantham 's a & e unit overnight has yet again been referred by the committee which scrutinises healthcare in the county to the government .
grantham hospital restricted its a & e opening hours in august 2016 due to a shortage of doctors .
lincolnshire 's health scrutiny committee says the decision `` was not only incorrect , but incorrectly taken '' .
the issue has previously been referred to the government , but it was decided that a full review was n't necessary .
however , the nhs in lincolnshire has been urged to be more `` open and honest '' about the future of its services .
health scrutiny committee chairman , carl macey , says this has n't happened :
still there has been no meaningful public involvement we 'd like to see options out to public consultation as soon as possible . ''

documents.title: watch : last british dambuster - 'i 'd do it again '
text: as the raf reaches its centenary , the last surviving british dambuster , lincolnshire-born george `` johnny '' johnson , has shared his experiences with a younger recruit .
the famous raid , which flew from raf scampton in lincolnshire on 17 may 1943 , saw experimental bouncing bombs used to break two important dams deep within nazi germany .
nineteen planes and 133 men took part in what was codenamed operation chastise , with eight planes lost and 53 crew killed :

documents.title: grimsby murder : further eyewitness sought by police
text: police have released a cctv image of a further person they say could be a key witness in their investigation into the murder of 45-year-old grimsby man tony richardson :
the latest appeal comes after police issued another cctv image of a potential eyewitness a little earlier this afternoon .
mr richardson died in hospital after being assaulted outside the halifax bank in old market place on monday evening .
det ch insp stewart miller says : `` there 's no suggestion that these people were involved in the incident that led to mr richardson 's death .
`` however , they were in the area shortly before it happened and may be able to provide us with vital information , so we would be very grateful if they could get in touch , '' he says .

documents.title: parris v carney : who 's got the best skills & celebration ? # fapeoplescup
text: ahead of this year 's fa people 's cup , we set england women 's football stars nikita parris and karen carney the challenge to see who 's got the best five-a-side skills and celebrations .
see how they got on
then sign up yourself for the free five-a-side tournament that gives you the chance to play at england 's training centre at st george 's park and go to the fa cup final .

documents.title: major road closed after crash
text: the a46 lincoln road , near nettleham , has been completely closed off after a crash .
it 's currently closed from the nettleham roundabout northwards .
drivers are being warned to avoid the area if at all possible .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: grimsby murder : eyewitness may have 'vital ' clues
text: police want to trace this woman because they believe she could be a key witness in the investigation into the murder of 45-year-old grimsby man tony richardson :
mr richardson died in hospital after being assaulted outside the halifax bank in old market place on monday evening .
det ch insp stewart miller said : `` there 's no suggestion that this lady was involved in the incident that led to mr richardson 's death .
`` however , she was in the area shortly before it happened and may be able to provide us with vital information , so we would be very grateful if she could get in touch . ''

documents.title: imps fan spells it out in lincoln
text: seems a suspected lincoln city supporter has been up to mischief in a supermarket in the city

documents.title: sheep 'savagely attacked ' on market rasen farm
text: a total of 17 sheep and rams have been `` savagely attacked '' on a farm near market rasen .
three of the sheep had to be put down after the attack while one is still seriously injured .
it 's believed they were attacked by a dog .
anyone who saw anything sus in croxby or brookenby is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: grimsby 's ice factory makes european 'endangered ' list
text: grimsby 's landmark former ice factory has been put on a shortlist of the most endangered heritage sites in europe .

just 12 sites have been selected for the list by europa nostra , which described itself as `` the voice of cultural heritage in europe '' , and the grade ii-listed ice factory is the only uk building on the list .
the factory was built in 1900 to provide crushed ice for grimsby 's trawlers , to keep fish fresh in the ship 's hold .
other threatened buildings and sites include the historic centre of vienna , the castle of sammezzano in tuscany , italy , and post-byzantine churches in albania .
henrietta billings , the director of save britain 's heritage , says she 's `` delighted the importance of grimsby 's fishing heritage has been recognised on the european stage '' :
the ice factory joins a group of high-profile sites and buildings across the continent singled out for their historic importance and vulnerability .
we hope this call to action will focus minds on the immediate challenge of halting the ongoing deterioration of this magnificent building , and finding new uses for its future . ''

documents.title: transit van thefts on the rise
text: owners of ford transit vans in lincolnshire are being warned about a spate of thefts in the past month .
nine of the vans have been stolen from various locations in west lindsey and north kesteven in the last four weeks .
the vans were all stolen and driven to rural locations before having their engines removed and being burned out .
police say owners of ford transit vans should `` be on their guard '' .

documents.title: watch : this afternoon 's forecast
text: a windy afternoon ahead with sunny spells and possible wintry showers .
watch my full forecast here :
author: Owain Wyn Evans
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: appeal sees grimsby attacker of boy , 2 , detained
text: a teenager from grimsby who threatened to throw a toddler out of a window has been sent to a young offenders ' institution after his original sentence was referred to the court of appeal .
joshua ingram , 18 , was originally given a suspended sentence after admitting making threats to kill , assault and criminal damage .
the offences related to an incident at his ex-girlfriend 's former home .
the case was referred to the court of appeal by the solicitor general robert buckland qc mp .
the court said the original sentence was `` unduly lenient '' and said he must be detained for three years .
this young man 's violent temper left a defenceless child and mother fearing for their lives .
the original sentence failed to take proper account of the seriousness of the offence .
i 'm pleased the court has seen fit to impose an immediate custodial sentence and i hope it brings some comfort to the victim . ''

documents.title: parliament discusses patient transport service
text: parliament 's heard claims that patients are being `` left stranded '' by the patient transport service in hull and northern lincolnshire .
the conservative mp for brigg and goole , andrew percy , has told the commons urgent action is needed to sort out thames ambulance service .
the government says a `` robust recovery plan '' is in place .
thames ambulance says it 's `` getting there '' , with improvements made to the service recently .

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: let 's have a quick look at some of the stories making the news in the county today :
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln bypass work stops after carillion collapse
text: work on lincoln 's eastern bypass has stopped after the collapse of infrastructure firm carillion .
the construction giant went bust yesterday , leaving tens of thousands of jobs at risk and dozens of infrastructure projects delayed .
the eastern bypass was due to open in late 2019 and is costing the taxpayer £ 65m and developers £ 34m .
it is being built to join the a15 sleaford rd with the a158 wragby road , encircling lincoln .
despite the work having stopped , lincolnshire county council leader martin hill says the eastern bypass `` will be built '' .
mr hill says most of carillion 's sub-contractors have suspended work until they know whether they will be paid or not .

documents.title: grimsby murder victim named
text: the victim of a fatal attack in grimsby earlier this week has been named as 45-year-old tony richardson .
mr richardson , from grimsby , died in hospital after being assaulted outside the halifax bank in old market place on monday evening .
police are continuing to appeal for witnesses to come forward , especially anyone who can identify a man officers want to speak to in connection with the attack .
the man is described as white , aged 20-45 , with dark-rimmed glasses .
he wore a beige or grey waist length jacket with a peaked hood .
he was also wearing dark trousers and grey or brown trainers .
det ch insp stewart miller says : `` we are investigating a number of new lines of enquiry and want to thank the public for the response by them in coming forward with information . ''

documents.title: defender leaves gainsborough trinity after just two weeks
text: it seems one of gainsborough trinity 's new signings has already had enough of the club after only being there for a fortnight .
lee beevers has left the team to take a coaching role at gainsborough rivals alfreton town .
beevers has previously played for lincoln city and boston united .
former lincoln city manager chris moyses has also moved in the last 24 hours to manage alfreton town fc .
author: James Williams
BBC Radio Lincolnshire Sport

documents.title: woman who 'filmed ' christmas day fight sought by police
text: police are looking for a woman who may have filmed a fight in boston which ended with a man getting serious head injuries .
the 29-year-old man is still in a serious condition after the fight on christmas day morning .
lincolnshire police say it happened near brothertoft road and sydney street ( below ) .
the victim is still being treated at queen 's medical centre in nottingham .
police are searching for three people who may have seen the fight happen .
one is a woman in her 20s who 's around 5ft tall with long dark hair .
police believe she may have filmed the fight on her phone .

officers are also looking for the driver of a white van who may have been driving on sydney street at the time and a couple who were walking down brothertoft road at about 02:00 on christmas morning .

documents.title: 'professional beggars ' issue raised in parliament
text: problems with professional beggars on the streets of cleethorpes are expected to be raised in the commons today .
a recent report by north east lincolnshire council found that 16 people beg on the streets there , despite having a home .
the town 's , mp martin vickers , says recently there was a `` rising problem '' with beggars in grimsby and the council there had come under pressure from traders to do something .
`` unfortunately , that 's moved the problem to the cleethorpes .
it 's been much more noticeable in recent months and it 's an issue that 's causing concern both to shopkeepers and to shoppers , '' says mr vickers .

documents.title: fire crews tackle house blaze in boston
text: one person has received treatment for the effects of breathing in smoke during a house fire in boston .
fire crews were sent to the property on brotherton road last night .
it 's believed the fire started in the kitchen when food was left cooking unattended .

documents.title: empty shopping centre an 'eyesore '
text: a shopping centre in sleaford has been described by local residents as an `` eyesore '' and `` deserted '' because it has so few shops in it .
the riverside centre in the town has 15 units for shops , but 10 of them are empty .
the traders who do have shops in the centre say the rent is expensive and it 's rising .
it 's after lincolnshire co-op spent £ 500,000 renovating the centre last year .
the co-op said it was `` working hard to bring new services to the area '' .
it 's bad really .
they say they 're trying to fill them but i think most people are being put off by the rent because it 's gone up since the renovations have been done .
it 's actually caused our footfall to go down . ''

documents.title: tree blocking major lincoln road
text: a tree has fallen and is blocking a busy road in lincoln .
the police have closed part of brant road after the tree came down opposite the shopping centre :
tree down opposite brant road shopping centre in # lincoln @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Gemma Dawson
BBC Look North

documents.title: most calls to lincolnshire fire service are n't fires
text: more than half the calls to lincolnshire fire and rescue service are for medical emergencies and not fires , according to statistics seen by bbc lincolnshire .
the service receives nearly 7,000 calls per year , but many - like the car accident above - are first dealt with by first responder volunteers .
firefighters at 26 stations are also trained to deal with medical emergencies like heart attacks .
sean taylor , divisional commander at lincolnshire fire and rescue , says crews can be `` on scene a lot quicker '' than paramedics from east midlands ambulance service .

documents.title: watch : wednesday 's weather
text: a cold and windy day ahead .
some sunny spells and wintry showers .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to wednesday 's live coverage
text: good morning on this chilly wednesday morning .
it 's harry here , guiding you through all the latest news , sport , and weather from across the county until 18:00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Harry Parkhill
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from me and the team here in lincoln for today .
we 'll be back from 08.00 tomorrow .
meanwhile , breaking news , sport and travel stories will continue right here throughout the night .
before we go , here 's a look back at five things we 've found out today :
bye for now !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: village 's landmark tiny cinema plans extra screen
text: a unique cinema in a lincolnshire village is expanding because staff there say they ca n't meet demand .
woodhall spa 's kinema in the woods already has two screens , but the management say they are often sold out .
a planning application has been submitted to east lindsey district council , with a proposed new auditorium adding a further 90 seats .
the cinema opened in 1922 after it was converted from a sports pavilion and has become a major attraction in the intervening years .
there have been some concerns raised by neighbours over parking .

documents.title: firms will 'pull together ' to keep city bypass on track
text: contractors in lincolnshire are ready to fill the gap left by collapsed construction firm carillion and to step in to complete lincoln 's eastern bypass , according to one of the businesses working on the scheme .
lincolnshire county council has reassured the public that work on the bypass will still go ahead , despite the announcement that carillion has gone into liquidation .
bruce spencer-knott is the managing director of lincoln-based minster surfacing , one of the current bypass contractors .
he says he does n't think they will lose money - and says there are many local businesses who could now take over work on the bypass .

documents.title: hunt for man who 'walked out ' of court before sentence
text: police in boston have appealed for help to find a man who walked out of the town 's court before magistrates had a chance to sentence him .
jordan jay gilbert , 24 , of willoughby road , boston , was in court this afternoon for a driving offence , but officers say he walked out of the foyer before he could be stopped .
he was wearing a large dark coloured raincoat and is about 5ft 6ins tall .
if you have seen him , you 're advised to contact 999 rather than approach him .
we anticipate that he will be looking for someone to help him and possibly provide a bed for the night .
i 'd like to make it clear that assisting an offender is in itself an offence and we 'd be looking to investigate anyone providing assistance to him . ''

documents.title: syrian refugees offered sanctuary
text: more than 160 syrian refugees have been given sanctuary in east yorkshire and northern lincolnshire over the past two-and-a-half years , it 's emerged .
east yorkshire has taken the highest number , with 72 people coming to live in the area .
mohamad abdeil wahab ( and his family have settled in scunthorpe after fleeing syria and travelling to turkey .
he says he `` lost everything in syria , but here i found everything '' :
i found a new home .
i found safety for my family . ''

documents.title: traffic and travel : a17 closed after pylon incident
text: the a17 in lincolnshire is currently closed in both directions after a lorry hit an electricity pylon .
police say the road will be closed for some time .
council highways workers are on the way to the scene at fosdyke , near boston , to set up diversions .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: lincolnshire school counting the costs
text: there 's a new currency in lincolnshire and it 's already in use !
pupils at kirton primary school near boston have invented the `` kirt '' .
teachers say it 's to help children learn the value of money and savings .
once saved , the `` kirts '' can then be spent in the school shop .

documents.title: man arrested after attempted robbery
text: police are appealing for witnesses after an attempted robbery on lincoln high street yesterday morning .
officers say a woman in her 40s was approached outside st botolph 's church at about 07:40 yesterday morning .
the victim was not injured and nothing was taken and officers have since identified and arrested a man in his 20s .
but they would still like to speak to anyone who was in the area at the time .
witnesses should call 101 .

documents.title: patient transport service is 'getting better '
text: as mps prepare to debate issues with the non-emergency patient transport service in hull and lincolnshire , the company behind the service says it is improving .
there have been complaints that thames ambulance service has failed to some patients up on time , meaning they have missed appointments , while others have been left stranded in hospital .
brigg and goole conservative mp andrew percy is due to hold a debate on the issue in the commons later .
in the meantime , thames ambulance service has issued this statement :

documents.title: man dies following street assault
text: man dies following street assault

documents.title: cannabis warning after homes turned into drug farms
text: landlords in lincolnshire are being warned by police to check up on tenants after two houses were used to grow drugs .
detectives say they 're investigating two cases in grantham where properties were used for cannabis production .
the cases involved houses in dysart road and south parade where tenants had paid their rent in full and immediately changed the locks .

documents.title: man charged after m3 crash lorry sheds paper and diesel
text: a man from scunthorpe has been charged after a lorry carrying 20 tonnes of paper overturned , forcing a partial closure of the m3 .
the vehicle also shed about 32 gallons ( 150 litres ) of diesel on the southbound road near junction 12 at eastleigh on sunday night .
a crash barrier was also damaged .
the man , 50 , is in custody accused of driving without due care and attention and failing to provide a specimen and is due before southampton magistrates .
the road reopened on monday morning .

documents.title: grimsby murder is 'isolated incident ' - police
text: an attack in grimsby which left a man dead is an `` isolated incident '' , according to humberside police .
the 47-year-old victim died in hospital today following an assault outside a bank on old market place yesterday afternoon .
det insp stewart miller says : `` at the current time we believe this was an isolated incident and there is no risk to the wider community .
`` our initial investigations have led us to believe this attack was not targeted at any specific section of the community and we will be increasing patrols in the area . ''

documents.title: new warning over lincoln a & e visits
text: medics have issued another warning about lincoln county hospital 's a & e department this lunchtime .
people are being told to stay away unless it is a genuine emergency .
the hospital has been suffering severe pressure for the last 48 hours .

documents.title: dennis greene returns to boston
text: former boston united manager dennis greene has been unveiled as the new manager of boston town .
town play in the united counties league , three divisions below his former club boston united , who play in the national league north :
breaking news : dennis greene takes over from gary frost as boston town manager .
more to follow
@ twitterid ! ! !

who you kidding had the best team in the league 3 seasons in a row before he rebuilt them into a load of crap
not sure boston town will rt that one
wow
so @ twitterid helps the future of the club with that fa cup run , then gets dumped for a fraud ! ! !
wo n't be going to town again anytime soon !

very good appointment
author: James Williams
BBC Radio Lincolnshire Sport

documents.title: murder investigation launched after attack in grimsby
text: a murder investigation has been launched in grimsby following a fatal attack on a 47-year-old man .
humberside police say the man was found injured on the pavement outside a bank on old market place yesterday afternoon .
he was taken to diana , princess of wales hospital for treatment , where he died this morning .
police say they are hunting for a man aged 20-45 with dark-rimmed glasses , wearing a beige or grey jacket with a peaked hood .

documents.title: breakingmurder investigation in grimsby
text: a murder investigation 's been launched after the discovery of a man 's body in the centre of grimsby .
more details to follow

documents.title: no mustard gas found in woodhall spa soil and water tests
text: water and soil samples taken from woodland in lincolnshire where deadly mustard gas was found last year have come back clear .
the ministry of defence ( mod ) took more than 200 samples from roughton wood , near woodhall spa , following the discovery of 150 canisters ( above ) last october .
a total of 140 were recovered from the woods site , while 10 were found in nearby stixwould lake .
scientists have found no trace of mustard gas or other chemical weapons .
but east lindsey district council says there 's still work to do on the site before it can be returned to the owners and the area remains cordoned-off .
the authority says a second phase of the wider investigation is now under way , involving the mapping of ordnance which could have been left on land previously used by the mod .

documents.title: mps to debate patient transport service issues
text: problems with a private ambulance service which provides non-emergency transport in hull and across lincolnshire are expected to be debated in parliament today .
there have been complaints that some patients have missed appointments while others have been left stranded in hospital because they were n't up by the thames ambulance group .
brigg and goole conservative mp andrew percy is due to hold a debate on the issue in the commons later .
thames ambulance service says improvements have been made .
author: Vicky Johnson
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: hospitals trust among worst for negligence payouts
text: compensation claims against lincolnshire 's hospitals have totalled more than £ 90m over the last five years , new bbc figures reveal .
it places united lincolnshire hospitals nhs trust ( ulht ) in the top 10 of english nhs trusts where mistakes have cost the most .
the trust runs lincoln county hospital , grantham and district hospital , pilgrim hospital in boston and county hospital in louth .
some of the cases date back as far as 1995 .
in a statement , ulht say mistakes may have occurred but the trust is using this as an opportunity to learn lessons and improve the quality of care for patients .

documents.title: listen : delay to lincoln bypass after carillion collapse ?
text: lincoln 's long-awaited eastern bypass is likely to be delayed , it 's emerged .
it 's because the construction firm carillion has gone into liquidation .
the county council says it 's getting legal advice , but the firm will continue with some work .
lincolnshire 's director for highways , richard wills , says he 's relieved it 's happened early on in the construction :

documents.title: £ 2m plans unveiled for new home for vulcan
text: a vulcan bomber which was once based in lincolnshire has moved a step closer to getting a permanent home after planning permission was granted for a visitors ' centre at doncaster-sheffield airport .

the aircraft - formerly based at raf waddington near lincoln - flew for the final time in 2015 and work has been ongoing to create a new hangar to help turn it into a visitor attraction in south yorkshire .
it 's thought the project will cost more than £ 2m , but could be completed next year if funding is secured .

documents.title: weather warning : black ice causing problems
text: here 's a from one of the roads near gainsborough - the cold conditions mean even the professional drivers are struggling .
thanks to malc for sending in the
beware people black ice is shocking round here on the side roads .
@ twitterid
hi malc .
are we ok to use the pic ( with full credit ) and can you tell us more about it please ?

no problem , was at blyton , lorry turned off the salted a159 onto pilham lane which had n't been , a sheet of ice you could n't even stand up , on a slight hill and bend did n't help either , luckily no damage done to vehicle or person .
the b645 will have ditches collecting upended cars and startled drivers who say , wide-eyed , 'i was n't going fast ! '
when being rescued .
like new boxy boundary trees , upended cars stand sentinel # b645 # icyroads
we had cardboard cutout police why not do same with cars , dotted along roadside ?
it 's a wonderful wiggly road on the cambs , northants , bedford borders , much beloved of motor cyclists , and i find it a joyful road to ride .
adverse cambers and tight corners mean folk get impatient and - da da da dah !
screech
whoops !

documents.title: watch : wrap up - it 'll be a cold one
text: a bitter wind with occasional wintry showers and sunny spells - here 's my full forecast :
author: Jennifer Bartram
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to tuesday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18.00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: that 's it from us for today , thanks for the company !
breaking news , sport , weather and travel updates will continue overnight .
we 'll leave you with five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: it 's time to talk money !
text: pupils at a school near boston will be showing off their money handling skills on tv later .
kirton primary has built a school bank where pupils can deposit rewards called 'kirts ' , which can then be spent in the school shop .
more on bbc one .
this school set up its own bank to teach kids about money .
@ twitterid debt special is on @ twitterid tonight at 7.30pm .
# bbcoutofdebt
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: man taken to hospital after grimsby assault
text: a man has been taken to hospital after being assaulted in grimsby .
the incident happened on hainton avenue this afternoon .
a man has been arrested .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: watch : 'seaside lane ' has slumped in to the sea
text: a road has been reclaimed by the sea in tunstall , near withernsea , on europe 's fastest eroding coastline .
author: Paul Murphy
BBC Look North

documents.title: lincolnshire produce taken to westminster
text: lincolnshire produce is being promoted to politicians in westminster this afternoon .
the mp for louth and horncastle , victoria atkins , has organised an event to champion locally-made items including plum bread , cheese , stuffed chine and gin !
defra minister george eustice sampling lincolnshire food in the commons
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: what next for lincoln 's bypass project ?
text: highways officials are looking at the options they have over the future of lincoln 's eastern bypass .
it comes as the main contractor , carillion , has gone into liquidation .
the county council says the company will continue to work on the project for the foreseeable future .
the new bypass will link the a158 wragby road with the a15 sleaford road .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln 's new bus station will open this month
text: the city of lincoln council has confirmed the new bus station will open on sunday , 28 january .
the finishing touches are being made and trial runs were carried out yesterday .
kate ellis from the authority says the bus operators who were on site were `` wowed by the bus station and the facilities it offers . ''
author: William Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: firefighters ' christmas fundraising hits £ 24,000
text: it seems lincolnshire 's firefighters have been doing their bit for charity .
after a lot of counting
christmas might seem like a long time ago already but we would like to offer our heartfelt thanks to you all for your support with our christmas fundraising .
with your help , we raised a service record of approx £ 24,000 for @ twitterid and approx £ 6,000 for local charities .
reflects all the hard work and dedication our personnel do throughout the year to support @ twitterid and many other local charities .
# proudfundraising
fabulous amount - well done to you all !
well done
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: new face on the imps board
text: lincoln city football club has announced a new appointment to the board .
new appointment to the board at sincil bank : # impsasone
this fantastic club goes from strength to strength
wembley please .
my dream is to watch the mighty imps play at wembley .
see you there soon greg with the rest of the team .
i 've followed lincoln since 1967 my first match at the bank was aldershot .
1/6 to get in and 6p for the 2 sheet programme .
author: James Williams
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: man badly injured in bottle attack
text: a man has suffered `` serious facial injuries '' after being hit on the head with a bottle .
boston cid are appealing for witnesses to an incident at the bus station on sunday , 7 january around 13:00 .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: boston man heads to the tower of london
text: a lincolnshire man is taking on the famous role of a beefeater .
chris clawson , from boston , is joining the team of yeoman warders at the tower of london .
it follows a long career in the raf .
the tower 's beefeaters are descended from the ancient band of warders who guarded the gates and royal prisoners early in the site 's history .
their modern duties mix a traditional ceremonial role with leading tours for visitors .
to qualify , applicants must have served for at least 22 years in the armed forces , hold the long service and good conduct medal and have reached the level of warrant officer .

documents.title: patients face big problems finding nhs dentists - watchdog
text: a health watchdog says it 's `` almost impossible '' to find an nhs dentist in lincolnshire after plans to open four new practices failed .
last year , nhs england promised to open new practices in sleaford , boston , spalding and lincoln , but nobody came forward to run them .
healthwatch lincolnshire says it 's had an unprecedented number of calls from worried patients .

documents.title: your lincolnshire headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories from the bbc lincolnshire newsroom this lunchtime include :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: listen : police and crime commissioner on tax hike plans
text: the humberside police and crime commissioner keith hunter wants people to give their views on plans to increase the policing element of council tax bills .
mr hunter says the increase could help pay for more officers .
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: masked gang target couple in 3am raid
text: a gang of masked men broke into a house in grimsby in the early hours of friday morning and threatened the couple living there .
humberside police say one of the masked suspects suffered a head injury in the incident on eleanor street at around 03:00 on friday 12 january .
officers say a tablet computer and a mobile phone were stolen in the raid .
the man and woman in the property were unhurt .
humberside police are appealing for anyone with information to get in contact them .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: your latest weather forecast ( wrap up warm ! ! )
text: staying unsettled in the county this afternoon and turning colder tomorrow .
here 's the latest forecast
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: carillion stops work on lincoln bypass
text: it looks fairly quiet on the construction site of lincoln 's eastern bypass after carillion went into liquidation
carillion construction work on lincoln 's eastern bypass has stopped after the firm announced its going into liquidation
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: trains back to normal after station fire
text: train services between lincolnshire and nottingham are running as normal today following friday 's fire .
however , parts of the station , including the ticket office , are still closed after suffering major damage in the blaze .
the bbc 's hayley compton said smoke could still be smelled throughout the building , which is also without water .
the fire , which started in the ladies ' toilets on friday morning , is being treated as arson and police are studying cctv footage .
you can smell the smoke and see the soot but apart from that it 's business as usual at nottingham station .
police are treating the fire on friday as arson which was so ferocious it melted some of the pipes which means there 's no water to the entire station .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: police want this man over clothing fire in lincoln
text: detectives investigating a fire which destroyed clothing donated for the homeless in lincoln have released a cctv image of a man they want to question .
the fire at compassionate lincoln 's warm rail for rough sleepers is being treated as arson .
it happened on grantham street in the city on 5 january .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : working men 's club closes after 120 years
text: one of the area 's oldest working men 's clubs has closed this weekend .
after 120 years , ashby cons social club in scunthorpe says it can no longer compete with the smoking ban and cheaper supermarket alcohol .
author: Sarah Walton
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: biker badly injured in a16 crash
text: a motorcyclist is in hospital with possible life-changing injuries following a crash on the a16 in lincolnshire .
the rider was in a collision with a car near north thoresby yesterday afternoon .
officers are appealing for witnesses .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: new bus station moves a step closer
text: it looks like lincoln 's new bus station could soon open .
bus trials taking place at lincoln central bus station today .
all going well and the building 's roof is definitely high enough , despite recent cheeky rumours to the contrary # lincolntransporthub

looking like the £ 11m i helped secure as the city 's conservative mp , from our @ twitterid government , has helped ensure a longstanding blot on our cityscape has been replaced by a high-roofed big-bayed fit for purpose bus station
shame about the abysmal service .
got the right on # notinservice .
my last bus home leaves at 18.15 , not many other routes carry on much later .
if i work late i need to pay taxi .
why have we paid millions for a fancy hub with no buses ?
lets see how long before it gets written on - and the homeless take it as their right to occupy it
@ twitterid see our new bus stn
congratulations on writing a great uk gov tweet .
( ranked 10th for jan 14 . )
i wonder who started that rumour , glad to see some progress .
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: sprinklers installed in scunthorpe tower blocks
text: sprinkler systems are being installed in four of scunthorpe 's high rise flats .
ongo homes , which owns the buildings , says it is investing £ 800,000 following the fatal fire at grenfell tower in london in june 2017 .
sprinklers are being installed at princess house , sutton house , crosby house and trent view house .
the sprinklers will be put in each flat and communal areas .
author: Phillip Norton
BBC News

documents.title: knife-wielding robber threatens pregnant shopworker in boston
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a pregnant shopworker was threatened during an armed robbery in boston .
it happened just before 13:00 on friday at the foodstop on vauxhall road in the town .
the offender went into the shop armed with a kitchen knife and demanded money from the pregnant member of staff .
he was given cash from the till , along with cigarettes and whisky , before leaving .
the woman working in the shop was left shaken but not hurt .
meanwhile , officers are also appealing for information after a robbery at o & m market shop on witham place in boston on saturday night .
two men , one armed with a knife , took a quantity of cash from the till .
it 's not believed the two incidents are linked .
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: carillion liquidation : lincoln bypass work delayed
text: lincolnshire county council has confirmed carillion 's work on lincoln 's eastern bypass has stopped .
the construction firm has gone into liquidation this morning .
the council 's director of highways , richard wills , says `` there will now be a delay of weeks or months '' .
the new bypass will link the a158 wragby road with the a15 sleaford road .
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: immigration centre fire
text: staff at morton hall immigration centre say they put out a small fire in one of the cells yesterday .
there were no injuries - and the fire was put out quickly .
author: Alex Rhodes
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : today 's forecast
text: if you 're going out today , do n't forget your brolly !
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to monday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
it 's paul with you today and i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , weather , sport and travel from across the county .
if you want to get in touch please do .
just send me an email , or a message on facebook or twitter .
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire
